Dear Brandon Hannah:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/15/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-
6992.

Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge:
(b) A brief summary or other documentation of the
services provided while in residence, including medical
and dental services.
(c) An assessment of the resident’s needs that
remain to be met.
(d) Any services that will be provided by the facility
after discharge.
(e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental follow
up that is needed, have been reviewed with the

resident and with the parent and with the responsible
case manager.
(f) The name and official title of the person to whom
the resident was discharged.
(b) One of four closed case files reviewed failed to document a brief summary or

(f) One of four closed case files reviewed, failed to include the name and official

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. The agency currently has three pending investigations (2023C0000368,
2023C0000529 and 2023C0000434) that include allegations that are being
investigated collaboratively with DCWL and the MIC unit.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The review period for this report began March 11, 2023 until current. The agency
was granted a 1st Provisional License at that time. The facility had a total of six
special investigations during this period under review with one resulting in
corrective action plan (CAP) and three that remain pending. The special
investigation resulting in non-compliance was for the agency not provididng

consistent therapy for youth as required. The corrective action plan included
specifc staff training on requirements of treatment goals of youth, and clinical
director oversight of therapy being completed weekly. The agency also had one
corrective action plan as a result of their 2022 interim inspection. The non-
compliances included case file documentation and initial health screening
requirements. Monthly unannounced visits to the facility have been completed and
implementation of their corrective action plan has been noted.
The agency was placed on a 1st provisional license as a result of special
investigation 2023C0137003. The agency was successful in implementing most of
the corrective action plan that was approved on March 13, 2023. They retrained
all staff on supervision requirements, and religious/spiritual policy and practices, in
March 2023. The five staff that were involved in the inappropriate restraint were
suspended and then terminated during the course of the investigation without the
ability to be rehired. The corrective action plan also included an action step for
clinical staff retraining on the updated program statement, report writing and
dissemination of information utilizing a communication flow chart. This was not yet
implemented as all the youth were moved out of Vassar House and staff were laid
off or reassigned to another area in early April 2023. As the agency is currently
without youth or staff, they have committed to implement the action steps when the
agency hires staff and resumes providing direct care to youth at Vassar House.
Financial Overview
A review of the financial documents for WHS - Vassar House were reviewed. No
areas of concern were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
The last PREA audit for Vassar House was completed on March 3, 2021. The
agency was found to be in compliance. Vassar House terminated their juvenile
justice contract on May 5, 2023.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review. The
assessment documented areas that the agency is looking to address via
Corrective Action Plans. The assessment also indicated an appropriate plan for
continued monitoring of compliance. The agency is currently without residents but
is maintaining an open mind about demonstrating substantial compliance and
returning to meeting the needs of youth through the program.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A total of three staff were interviewed as a part of the renewal inspection. No
concerns were noted, and the employees provided positive feedback regarding the
company and the improvements that they believe the current administration is
making. Those changes include, but are not limited to, adjustment in staff to youth
ratio, new CPI protocol and the use of compliance forms to document strengths
and areas of improvement for the agency.

No youth were interviewed as a part of this renewal. The facility is currently
without any youth and the last youth was discharged on 4/4/2023.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency was completed. The facility was found to be in good
condition. Currently there are no youth residing at the facility, so it is secured and
locked to prevent unwanted entrance.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
